wikipedia_page.main: Billy Higgins (born 14 August 1945, in Bootle, England) is a British karateka. He has an 8th Dan black belt in karate, and is the winner of multiple karate medals including World Karate Championships and is a karate instructor for the Karate Union of Great Britain.

response: The 1976 championships were the first to offer several weight classes in the individual event, in this case a total of three. Britain's Billy Higgins won the final of the men's individual kumite -70 kg. The British team was led by Roy Stanhope. Varasteh's students won a gold medal in one event and a silver medal two other categories. Iran's Farrokh Moshfegh also won a bronze medal, and his teammate Morteza Alborzi won fourth place.
